headline: Ask HN: Why is chromes typo suggestions much worse than searches autocorrect?
description: Just now I was trying to spell "manipulable" and I typed in "manipuble". It gave three options to fix this: "manipulee", "maniple", and "manipulees". But if you just try to google "manipuble", it will inform you that it's instead searching for "manipulable". I can't think of a single time when searching for a misspelled word didn't yield the correct spelling as the first suggested result, but it's almost a daily occurrence for chromes typo suggestions to avoid suggesting the correct, seemingly nearby, word. This feels like a newish occurrence too, I don't remember ever having this much issue with it years ago.
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 为什么chromes的错别字建议比搜索的自动更正差很多？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 為什麼chromes的錯別字建議比搜索的自動更正差很多？
description_zh-Hans: 刚才我试图拼写"manipulable"，我输入了"manipuble"。它给出了三个选项来解决这个问题："manipulee"，"maniple"，以及"manipulees"。但是，如果你只是试图用谷歌搜索"manipuble"，它就会通知你，它反而在搜索"manipulable"。我想不出有什么时候搜索一个拼写错误的词时，没有得到正确的拼写作为第一个建议的结果，但几乎每天都会发生色差错的建议，以避免建议正确的、看起来很近的词。这感觉也是一种新的现象，我不记得几年前有过这么多问题。
